Legal moves from (4,0):
- UP -> (4,1): free.
- LEFT -> (3,0): free.
- RIGHT -> (5,0): neck (illegal).
- DOWN -> off board (illegal).

Safety check:
- Neither UP nor LEFT is immediately lethal.
- No enemy head can reach (4,1) or (3,0) this turn, so no head-on risk this move.

Tactical considerations:
- UP moves me straight toward the apple at (4,3) (3 steps away). Note: snake #1 (head at 5,3) can take (4,3) immediately by moving LEFT this turn, so I likely won’t get that apple first. Still, moving UP keeps my path north open and maintains multiple escape options (left or right/up later) rather than committing into the lower-left corridor immediately.
- LEFT moves me toward the left-side apples (0,3),(1,6),(0,7) but is a longer route and narrows options faster along my own body loop. It also doesn’t prevent the opponent from taking (4,3) next turn.

Short-term plan:
- Move UP now to keep options open and head north. If snake #1 takes (4,3), pivot toward the left cluster of apples using safe lateral moves and avoid head-on contests. Watch snake #1’s head movement from (5,3); avoid entering cells they can reach in one move if I’d collide head-on.
